results.title: Spelling Bee Forum
results.abstract: Feeling stuck on today’s puzzle? We can help.

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Legal Profession;Classified Information and State Secrets;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);United States Politics and Government;Project Democracy;Bobb, Christina;Trump, Donald J;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Justice Department;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Homeland Security Department;One America News Network
results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: She Went Out on a Limb for Trump. Now She’s Under Justice Dept. Scrutiny.
results.abstract: Christina Bobb is a former Marine and a fervent believer that the 2020 election was stolen from Donald J. Trump. She went to work for him and quickly found herself enmeshed in an obstruction investigation.

media.caption: Christina Bobb, a former One America News Network anchor, was a late addition to former President Donald J. Trump’s legal team. She is now at the heart of the Justice Department’s criminal investigation into his handling of White House documents.
media.copyright: Megan Mendoza/The Republic, via USA Today Network

results.adx_keywords: Black Holes (Space);Space and Astronomy;Gravitation and Gravity;Physics;Quantum Theory;internal-sub-only;your-feed-science;Hawking, Stephen W;California Institute of Technology;Stanford University
results.title: Black Holes May Hide a Mind-Bending Secret About Our Universe
results.abstract: Take gravity, add quantum mechanics, stir. What do you get? Just maybe, a holographic cosmos.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Actors and Actresses;Television;Theater;Movies;Tony Awards (Theater Awards);Lansbury, Angela
results.title: Angela Lansbury, Star of Film, Stage and ‘Murder, She Wrote,’ Dies at 96
results.abstract: She was a Hollywood and Broadway sensation, but she captured the biggest audience of her career as the TV sleuth Jessica Fletcher.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Classified Information and State Secrets;Archives and Records
results.byline: By Maggie Haberman and Alan Feuer
results.title: Trump Aide Was Seen on Security Footage Moving Boxes at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: The aide, Walt Nauta, moved the boxes from a storage room before and after the Justice Department issued a subpoena demanding the return of all classified documents held by the former president.

media.caption: The Justice Department had subpoenaed security camera footage from former President Donald J. Trump’s Mar-a-Lago residence in Palm Beach, Fla.
media.copyright: Saul Martinez for The New York Times

results.title: The ‘Sleeping Giant’ That May Decide the Midterms
results.abstract: The choices made by Latino voters will be crucial to the outcome in a disproportionate share of Senate battleground states and key House races.

media.caption: Monica De La Cruz, the Republican candidate in Texas’ 15th Congressional District, at a rally in McAllen, Texas.
media.copyright: Verónica G. Cárdenas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: internal-sub-only;Content Type: Personal Profile;Burning Man Festival;Bars and Nightclubs;High Net Worth Individuals;Musk, Elon;PayPal;Tesla Motors Inc
results.title: Elon Musk Has the World’s Strangest Social Calendar
results.abstract: When the world’s richest man isn’t tweeting, he’s flying to Burning Man, trying to impress comedians and hopping on yachts.

media.caption: Elon Musk at this year’s Met Gala in New York.

results.title: ‘Do these people actually think they’re getting any money?’ Jones denounces the verdict, and fund-raises.
results.abstract: Broadcasting in tandem with the court hearing, Alex Jones called the $965 million judgment against him a “joke,” and urged his viewers to send him hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for an appeal.

media.caption: Alex Jones with private security guards after appearing at his Sandy Hook defamation trial last week.

results.title: Health Panel Recommends Screening All Kids 8 and Up for Anxiety
results.abstract: To address the mental health crisis facing American youth, experts also said adolescents should be screened for depression.
org_facet: United States Preventive Services Task Force

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Private and Sectarian Schools;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Hasidism;Rosa, Betty A;Education Department (NYC);Education Department (NYS);Brooklyn (NYC);New York City;New York State
results.byline: By Eliza Shapiro and Brian M. Rosenthal
results.title: Hasidic School Is Breaking State Education Law, N.Y. Official Rules
results.abstract: Issued amid a lawsuit brought by a parent who left the community, the determination could signal challenges for scores of Hasidic Jewish schools.

media.caption: Yeshiva Mesivta Arugath Habosem, an all-boys Hasidic school in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is not complying with a state education law requiring private schools to offer basic secular studies.

results.title: MacArthur Foundation Announces 25 New ‘Genius’ Grant Winners
results.abstract: The 2022 awards are going to artists, activists, scholars, scientists and others who have shown “exceptional creativity.” The grants are a bit bigger than before: $800,000 over five years.
org_facet: MacArthur, John D and Catherine T, Foundation

media.caption: From left, Professors P. Gabrielle Foreman, Yejin Choi and Loretta J. Ross, who are among those awarded this year’s MacArthur Fellowships.
media.copyright: via John D. and Catherine T. MacArthur Foundation

results.adx_keywords: Football;Doctors;Careers and Professions;Content Type: Personal Profile;Rolle, Myron;Pittsburgh Steelers
results.title: It’s Never Too Late to Pivot From N.F.L. Safety to Neurosurgeon
results.abstract: When Myron Rolle was cut from the Pittsburgh Steelers, he fell into a funk until his mother reminded him of his two childhood dreams: Play football, then become a neurosurgeon. It was time for Plan B.

media.caption: Dr. Myron Rolle became a neurosurgeon at Massachusetts General Hospital after his football glory days ended.
media.copyright: Ryan Christopher Jones for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Actors and Actresses;Movies;internal-sub-only;Curtis, Jamie Lee
results.title: Under the Skin of Jamie Lee Curtis
results.abstract: Whether it’s her return to her horror roots in “Halloween Ends” or her buzzy performance in “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” freedom is what the actress is after.

media.caption: “I feel all the feels, all the time,” Jamie Lee Curtis said.
media.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;War and Armed Conflicts;Prisons and Prisoners;Political Prisoners;Decisions and Verdicts;Basketball;Griner, Brittney;Whelan, Paul N;Russia
results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Michael Crowley
results.title: Brittney Griner Is Increasingly Anxious She May Not Be Freed, Lawyer Says
results.abstract: Facing nine years in prison in Russia, the U.S. basketball star is struggling emotionally and worried that a swap deal to release her may not materialize, according to one of her attorneys.

media.caption: Brittney Griner at a court outside Moscow in August. The United States has said that her detention and trial were politically motivated.

results.adx_keywords: City Councils;Race and Ethnicity;Martinez, Nury;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.byline: By Jill Cowan and Shawn Hubler
results.title: Los Angeles City Councilwoman Resigns Amid Uproar Over Racist Remarks
results.abstract: The former Council president, Nury Martinez, faced calls from state leaders and President Biden to leave office after making racist remarks on a recording that emerged on Sunday.

media.caption: The former Los Angeles City Council president Nury Martinez during a news conference in Los Angeles last month. Ms. Martinez announced her resignation as a councilwoman on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Al Seib/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Hospitals;Children and Childhood;Rural Areas;Shutdowns (Institutional);Emergency Medical Treatment;Shortages;Medicaid;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Doctors;your-feed-healthcare;United States;Oklahoma
results.title: As Hospitals Close Children’s Units, Where Does That Leave Lachlan?
results.abstract: Adult beds are more lucrative than children’s beds. So as institutions look to boost profit margins, pediatrics is often among the first services to be cut.

media.caption: Lachlan’s morning routine involves time with the inhaler after breakfast while preparing for school.
media.copyright: Melissa Lukenbaugh for The New York Times

results.title: Putin Has Sent Us a Message, but Not the One He Meant To
results.abstract: Among Ukrainians, there is an almost palpable feeling that Russia is losing the war.

results.title: Navy Report on SEAL Trainee’s Death Details Medics’ Failure to Help Him
results.abstract: Seaman Kyle Mullen’s death a few hours after completing the brutal Hell Week portion of the SEALs’ selection course raised broad concerns about how the course is run.
des_facet: United States Defense and Military Forces

media.caption: Navy SEAL candidates in the Basic Underwater Demolition course in Coronado, Calif., in 2018, in a photo commissioned by the Defense Department.

results.title: Here’s what Russia’s attacks may indicate about its weapons stockpile.
results.abstract: Russia’s assault on Ukraine on Monday raised questions about the capacity of Moscow’s forces to carry out President Vladimir V. Putin’s military calculations.

media.caption: A Russian rocket serves as a reminder of the relentless bombardment of Kharkiv, Ukraine.
media.copyright: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times

results.title: Jimmy Kimmel Responds to Trump Lashing Out at Late Night
results.abstract: “I didn’t even see it, that’s how badly his social media platform is doing,” Kimmel said of Trump’s Truth Social rant about late night hosts.

media.caption: “And as far as ratings go, on behalf of my fellow late night talk show hosts — Jimmy, Stephen, Seth and I — we’ve been on for a total of 58 seasons and counting; your presidency got canceled after one,” Jimmy Kimmel said.
